# Welcome {-} 

<div style="float: left; margin-right: 30px;"><a target="_blank"  href="https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/149204637X/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&creativeASIN=149204637X&linkCode=as2&tag=therinspark-20&linkId=17909c41c4eafaec27db6040b8127bf3"><img border="0" src="https://therinspark.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/mastering-spark-with-r.png" width="200" style="border: solid 1px #edb19e;"></a><img src="//ir-na.amazon-adsystem.com/e/ir?t=therinspark-20&l=am2&o=1&a=149204637X" width="1" height="1" border="0" alt="" style="border:none !important; margin:0px !important;" /></div>

In this book you will learn how to use [Apache Spark](https://spark.apache.org/) with [R](http://www.r-project.org/). The book intends to take someone unfamiliar with Spark or R and help you become proficient by teaching you a set of tools, skills and practices applicable to [large-scale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_data) [data science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_science).
